moves.10. h3: Computers dislike this move, even though it gives White a pair of bishops.
Before going on with the king-side attack, White decide to stop the possible breakthrough on the queen-side. Unfortunately, this weakens control over b4 square, which Black knights find very attractive.
moves.14... Ne7c6 15. Qd2: White's plan is to exchange dark-squared bishops and launch an attack on the Black king.
moves.15... Nb4: Black seizes the opportunity provided by White's 14.a4?! move.
moves.16. Rad1: Sooner or later White plans to play Bh6, which may require Qxh6. Thus, while the queen is away, the rook will protect the d3 pawn.
moves.16... Nec6 17. Bh6 Ne5: The knight returns to a square it was on just a move ago. Perhaps Black decided to use it in defense rather than attack, after all.
moves.18. Bxg7 Kxg7 19. f4 Nd7: Computers are happy to play 20.d4 here, but in the game White prefers a king-side attack to a central domination.
moves.20. Rde1: The "e" and "f" files will soon be exploded, and White wants to take control of it right now.
moves.20... Nc6 21. f5 Nd4 22. Bg4: Joining the attack. If necessary, White will sacrifice the bishop to proceed.
moves.22... exf5: A real mistake, allowing White to finally use its trump cards.
moves.23. exf5 Nf6 24. Bd1:
After 24.fxg6 Nxg4 25.hxg4 fxg6 I was not sure how to proceed with the attack, so I decided to keep the bishop. 

Black should have taken the chance to equalize with 24...Nxf5 here.
moves.24... Qc7: Rather pointless move. The queen is hardly of any use on this square.
moves.25. fxg6 fxg6 26. Rf2: Rooks are preparing for an assault against Black king. Something must be done.
moves.26... Rae8: White's following move gives the opponent an opportunity to fall into a tactical trap.
moves.27. Rxe8 Rxe8: And the trap works! It looks natural to take with a rook -- after all, how good can 27...Nxe8 28.Rxf8 Kxf8 29.Qh6+ be for Black? But a knight on a rim is better than a knight off the board, as the White's following move proves.
moves.28. Rxf6: ...and Black should accept the loss of a knight. Taking the rook only makes it worse.
moves.28... Kxf6 29. Nd5+: And Black resigned facing the inevitable 30.Nxc7.
